sentence.Network_en: An inflow of capital is a surplus.

entry.def: If there is an inflow of money or people into a place, a large amount of money or people move into a place.

example.ex: The Swiss wanted to discourage an inflow of foreign money.
example.tran: 瑞士人想要阻止外资流入。

example.ex: ...the inflow of immigrants from Eastern Europe

auth_sentence.content: The inflow of money from savers had picked up.

auth_sentence.content: But he says that an inflow of capital also poses challenges.

auth_sentence.content: It was slipping into the river, into the inflow channel.

Sentence.sentence: Some argue that people are anxious and feel threatened by an inflow of new workers.
What is the chief concern of native high-skilled, better-educated employees about the inflow of immigrants

But over the next few decades labour forces in rich countries are set to shrink so much that inflows of immigrants would have to increase enormously to compensate: to at least twice their current size in western Europe's most youthful countries, and three times in the older ones.

sentences.en: Money supply has been swollen by a large capital inflow.
